How is it that nobody here has heard of PoE (Power on Ethernet) devices and 
remote asset management? IT System Admins setup office computers to update 
during silent hours (between 12-5 am usually) so as to cause minimum 
disruption of work. Since all the machines come on simultaneously I am 
pretty certain that they are being triggered by a remote process for system 
maintenance/update.... lets be a bit scientific and analyse what we see 
before believing it to be paranormal/supernatural. I mean come on! Of all 
the things why would a ghost turn on a PC? Is it that urgent to check mail 
at that time? Or doesn't he have a fast internet connection where he lives? 
:P﻿

+Yusuf Ansari
Well said. I have a friend who's been working at a fairly new place for 
about 5 months or so, at night when he's working door handles starts to 
shake, and there's no one there doing it, and things falls to the ground, 
and alarms starts to go on and off, ghosts wasn't on his mind until last 
week when he was about to take a rest at his work, his phone started 
beeping because of low battery and 3 seconds later about 1 meter behind him 
he heard a 4 second long scratching sound on a kitchen table, and the day 
after he had a bruise on his chest. People who works there told him that 
it's a ghost there. So no matter if you believe it or not, if there's a 
ghost around you can't really avoid being affected by the things it's doing.
